intro: Oncostemum laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, cylindrical stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. Oncostemum laevigatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
